com.gracenote.mmid.MobileSDK

Class GNAudioSourceMic

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gracenote.mmid.MobileSDK.GNAudioSourceMic

  • public class GNAudioSourceMic
extends java.lang.Object
    The GNAudioSourceMic class manages resources for applications to stream audio from the platform's audio input hardware. The application receives the recorded audio (PCM-encoded) by implementing the GNAudioSourceMicDelegate interface.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GNAudioSourceMic(GNAudioConfig audioConfig, GNAudioSourceDelegate inAudioSourceMicDelegate)
      Acquires audio input hardware resource and initializes it as specified by audioConfig.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void startRecording()
      Starts recording, will re-acquire audio input hardware resources if it has been previously released
      void stopRecording()
      Stops recording and releases the audio input hardware resource

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GNAudioSourceMic

        public GNAudioSourceMic(GNAudioConfig audioConfig,
                GNAudioSourceDelegate inAudioSourceMicDelegate)
        Acquires audio input hardware resource and initializes it as specified by audioConfig. Below are the limitations to the audio configuration parameters supported:
        • number of channels: 1 or 2, otherwise the platform's default channel configuration is used
        • bytes per sample: 1 or 2, otherwise 2 is used by default
        Parameters:
        audioConfig - configuration object specifying audio data format
        inAudioSourceMicDelegate - object which implements the GNAudioSourceDelegate interface to receive recorded data

    • Method Detail

      • startRecording

        public void startRecording()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Starts recording, will re-acquire audio input hardware resources if it has been previously released
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if microphone initialization failed, either the hardware resource could not be acquired or the passed audio configuration parameters are not supported

      • stopRecording

        public void stopRecording()
        Stops recording and releases the audio input hardware resource
